channel.title: dataFude | Debugging with Simulator Logs
channel.description: Recent content on dataFude | Debugging with Simulator Logs

item.title: dataFude 1.7
item.description: dataFude 1.7 is a minor update bringing the following new features: Introduces the first special dataFude syntax! So far dataFude recognizes automatically certain log values — for example Enabled: true or Working: NO are rendered as switch tiles without any special syntax: Version 1.7 introduces the first custom syntax that enables a dataFude feature — the $symbol() function renders an SF Symbol for when you need to display a status or action in a more visual way.

item.title: dataFude 1.6
item.description: dataFude 1.6 is a minor update bringing the following new features: The “Add new app” window now offers autocompletion features that searches in the list of recently used apps and the list of installed apps in the currently running Simulator. Quality of life improvements to the behavior in Welcome window and New App window. Enjoy dataFude 1.6!

item.title: dataFude 1.5
item.description: dataFude 1.5 is a minor update bringing the following new features: dataFude would now track signpost intervals in Apple’s unified log and visualize them in a new kind of timer tile. Repeating intervals display the total time and the number of repeats. Use Apple’s os_signpost or OSLogger APIs to track intervals, like so: os_signpost(.begin, log: log, name: "My Activity") ... os_signpost(.end, log: log, name: "My Activity") A new preferences tab called “Features” allows users to turn on and off features.

item.title: Debug SwiftUI with a custom view modifier
item.description: Logging values and seeing them visualized in dataFude is pretty powerful but the core concept of the app really shines when a developer would automate logs that drive metrics over time. Such metrics could be any value that changes over time — the size of the app cache, consumed RAM, or how many instances of a given class are created. In this article we’ll look into logging how many times a SwiftUI view is re-created.

item.title: dataFude 1.4
item.description: dataFude 1.4 is a minor update bringing a number of quality-of-life improvements to the app: When you relaunch your iOS app from Xcode — dataFude detects the restart and resets the data in the currently visible tiles so you see only the data since the latest app launch. This improvement relieves the need to add pre-run script to projects — dataFude now detects relaunches and reset the data on its own.

item.title: dataFude launches today!
item.description: I’m glad to share that dataFude is launching today on ProductHunt and the AppStore today! dataFude is an Xcode companion app to see your debugging data in a beautiful and bold UI. Log your debug data as usual using Apple’s logging framework, and dataFude will automatically select and display your logs! It’s a powerful native developer tool that is focused on making developers more productive while developing with Xcode and the Simulator.

item.title: dataFude is on TestFlight now!
item.description: Today “dataFude” is available as a public beta on TestFlight. Install the beta version from TestFlight The open beta will run through the month of December and all beta testers will have access to Pro features: What’s available in the beta? Running safely in the mac app sandbox. Reads logs from the Xcode Simulator in real time. Automatically captures relevant log lines and displays the data. Beautiful data visualization. Start manually or integrate in your Xcode project with no code changes.

item.title: Beta Available Now!
item.description: The public beta of dataFude is available today. Download on a mac computer and power up your development with beautiful real-time debug data! What’s available in the beta? Use dataFude as a beautiful log renderer, instead of using prints. Automatically captures relevant log lines and displays the data. Real-time text or chart visualization. Integrate in your Xcode workflow with no code changes. Download the beta version here

item.title: Reroute print() to the unified log system
dataFude — Press Kit
item.description: Meta Information Name: dataFude Available On: Mac App Store Category: Developer Tools Platform: macOS 12 or later Flavors: dataFude is Free. Pro upgrade with 2 week trial, then paid subscription. Download: https://apps.apple.com/app/datatile-for-simulator/id6444231603 Contact: support {at} underplot.com Description dataFude is an innovative Xcode companion-app to see debugging data in a beautiful and bold UI. Developers log debug data as usual using Apple’s logging framework, and dataFude automatically selects and displays the logs!

item.title: Pricing Note
item.description: dataFude MAX The app is distributed as a free limited version. From the Preferences window users can purchase a MAX license for a duration of 1 year. Once the license expires it does not renew automatically and the app is usable as the free Mini version again. Users can choose to renew the license for another year at will. dataFude The app is distributed as a free limited version. From the Preferences window users can purchase a Pro subscription which can be billed either monthly or yearly.

item.title: Privacy Note
item.description: 1 Key points Processing of sensitive personal information: dataFude does not store or process personal or identifying information. Anonymized usage information: dataFude collects anonymous usage data in order to prioritize future development. This data isn’t related in any way to the users who generate it. Payments and App Store accounts: When you make a purchase in the app and/or manage your app subscription you are doing this through the services Apple offers on their macOS platform that is installed on your computer.
